[Spoiler] Back to the Future Easter egg in Episode 8?
WRITING.TEXT:
Just before Eleven unleashes her full energy, the clock on the classroom wall reads [almost 10:04.](http://i.imgur.com/xRYXEQl.jpg)
10:04 is the time when lightning struck the Hill Valley clock tower in Back to the Future.
Is Eleven putting out 1.21 Gigawatts??
If it's not an Easter egg, it's a continuity error, because Mr. Clarke says it's "10:00 on a Saturday" on the phone in Episode 7, hours before the scene in Episode 8. So I'm going with Easter egg.
And... November 12, the date of the BTTF lightning strike in 1955, was also a Saturday night in 1983.
Stranger Things begins on November 6, 1983, meaning that the climactic Saturday night was November 12.

WRITING.TITLE: Stone Temple Pilots' letter to Scott Weiland.
WRITING.TEXT:
[Posted on Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/stpband/posts/10153636913457906) this afternoon:
Dear Scott,
Let us start by saying thank you for sharing your life with us.
Together we crafted a legacy of music that has given so many people happiness and great memories.
The memories are many, and they run deep for us.
We know amidst the good and the bad you struggled, time and time again.
Its what made you who you were.
You were gifted beyond words, Scott.
Part of that gift was part of your curse.
With deep sorrow for you and your family, we are saddened to see you go.
All of our love and respect.
We will miss you brother,
Robert, Eric, Dean

WRITING.TEXT:
The one time I tried Ryanair, I checked in early, was issued a boarding pass, went to the airport the next day, had the computer claim there was an error with said boarding pass, paid for a second pass ($37), and got to the gate for my delayed flight.
After the extra wait, they then refused to board me, claiming that my boarding pass, which they had issued me TWICE, was invalid because of a passport issue. Even though I entered all my passport information twice and was issued a pass without issue twice. Took me two months to get hold of a real person to complain, that person refused to take even partial responsibility and decided that it was proper for them to keep my money for a flight they never let me take.
I loved Ireland, I hated Ryanair. Never, ever again.

WRITING.TEXT: The loneliness in that scene had a 99% purity level.

Of course, it's better AND worse. Being unmarried my whole life and nearing 40, I've traversed dating in both eras. As you allude to in your latest show, it's so much more common now for people to bail on a date or just go silent and ignore someone when most of your communication is done through texting. I've seen it more and more as the years have passed. In fact, it happened to me exactly one night before I traveled to Tulsa to see your show, and it stung a little less laughing as you walked through the exact scenario that had happened to me.
On the flip side of that, knowing how to talk to a girl on the phone is suddenly a huge advantage. Most of the time. Sometimes, girls in their 20s almost get creeped out when you call them, like it has somehow become crossing a line too quick. But generally, it's so much better in coordinating dates and helps establish rapport before you ever meet up.
I'm not knocking texting, it has also saved me from anger and wrath when plans have changed at the last minute. I remember one particular date before I had a cell phone when traffic and other delays had me so late, I was freaking out the whole time that my night and future chances with her were toast. Luckily, they weren't.
I think being able to know that much more about someone before you ever meet them in the smartphone era is great, but part of me does miss just showing up at the door for the first date and the mystery of what you were about to experience.

WRITING.TITLE: A thought on the final episodes and violence. (Spoilers in discussion)
WRITING.TEXT:
The deeper we go into the final episodes, and the more brutal the stakes, the less graphic the on-screen violence has become. It's all emotional gore now.
Declan and his crew? Killed off-screen, audio only. Gomez? Death not seen. Hank? Cut-away just as the fatal shot is fired. Even the shot to his leg isn't shown. Jesse's latest brutal beating? We only see the aftermath.
The most graphic bloodletting we see is Skyler cutting Walt with the butcher knife. Because it's the most personal and emotional.

The Mayans aren't even mentioned the last 90 minutes of the movie, the whole premise of the movie that they put on the posters and all the promotional materials is completely abandoned for shitty acting, reaction shots, and of course, saving a puppy.
